result.execSummary:
The defendant Dashod D Crutchfield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program, IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY THE WISCONSIN DEPT. OF CORRECTIONS
Court ordered the Dosage Probation Program

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample (unless previously done); pay surcharge. Pay the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges to be paid over a period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Restitution set at ZERO.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
- No Contact with the victims.
- No Contact with the co-actors.
- Complete a job training program to enhance ability to obtain employment.
- Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

timeConds.notes:
Release privileges for employment, school, and treatment purposes only. Court ordered "GOOD TIME RELEASE CREDIT" towards condition time.

**10-5-15, Order granting specific orders as to additional treatment purposes only, including counseling or therapy from Family Options.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for Cancellation of Huber, signed and filed

Huber/Work Release Modification Request
.
Request for Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge  Judge Conen Br 30, for review. os

The defendant's request for "specific" orders as it relates to defendant's release privileges for treatment is GRANTED.  Defendant may be released for treatment purposes, including counseling or therapy from Family Options - signed and filed.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. M. Joseph Donald, Br. 2, for review. jbs
Letter from defense counsel seeking amendment to judgment of conviction with respect to type of treatment.
Dosage Probation Approved.

Defendant Dashod D Crutchfield in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  Defendant Dashod D Crutchfield in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:    Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS. 
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS. 
Credit given for 128 days time served if revoked.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program,  IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.
.
COURT STAYS sentence and places defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS under the supervision of Wisconsin Department of Corrections.
.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 1): 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
* SERVE 10 MONTHS "condition time" at the House of Correction with release privileges for employment, school, and treatment purposes only.  Court ordered "GOOD TIME RELEASE CREDIT" towards the condition time.
* No contact with the victims.
* No contact with the co-actors.
* Complete a job training program to enhance ability to obtain employment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample (unless previously done) and PAY DNA surcharge  - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered the Dosage Probation Program.
* Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.

  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.
(4) Defendant's Character Witness Letters.
Letter from Franklin Public Schools.

Defendant Dashod D Crutchfield in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  Defendant Dashod D Crutchfield in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.
Defendant's Character Witness Letters; filed.
for Reduction of Bail filed by the defendant PRO SE.  Court awaits parties' request for a Bail/Bond Hearing court date.

Attorney Matthew Russell Meyer in court, defendant Dashod D Crutchfield not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Plea and Sentencing Hearing date.
Case adjourned to 07-16-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Attorney Matthew Russell Meyer in court, defendant Dashod D Crutchfield not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a status conference date.
Case adjourned to 06-02-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status Conference.

Per request of the State, and with permission of the clerk of Judge Donald, Court allowed case to be transferred back to Judge Donald, Branch 02, as that is ADA McNutt's court.  Parties request a scheduling date.  Court ordered case adjourned for scheduling.   Scheduling conference scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew Russell Meyer in court, defendant Dashod D Crutchfield not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived his client's appearance.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Same bail.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Dashod D Crutchfield in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  Defendant Dashod D Crutchfield in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20 due to co-defendant's lower pending case.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Trayvion B./Anthony W. or co-defendants.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Dashod D Crutchfield in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Dashod D Crutchfield in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Quick date set due to co-defendant's previously scheduled Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
